ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.2_0: At that time a certain man said to another man,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.3_0: “I’ll give a robe to Venerable Upananda.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.4_0: And they all gave the same reply.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.5_0: “I, too, will give a robe to Venerable Upananda.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.6_0: An alms-collecting monk heard that conversation.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.9_0: In such-and-such a place I heard two men telling each other
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.10_0: that they will each give you a robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.11_0: And they all gave the same reply.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.12_0: that I will give you a robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.14_0: Upananda then went to those men and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.15_0: “Is it true, reverend, that you wish to give me a robe?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.17_0: that’s just what we were thinking.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.18_0: “If that’s the case, then give me such-and-such a robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.19_0: For what’s the point of giving robes that I won’t use?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.20_0: The men complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.21_0: “These Sakyan ascetics have great desires; they are not content.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.22_0: It’s no easy matter to give them robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.23_0: How can Venerable Upananda approach us and specify the kind of robe he wants without first being invited?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.24_0: The monks heard the complaints of those men,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.25_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.26_0: “How can Venerable Upananda approach householders and make a suggestion about a robe without first being invited?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.27_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.28_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.32_0: “Foolish man, people who are not related don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.33_0: And still you went to an unrelated householder and specified the kind of robe you wanted without first being invited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.34_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.35_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.36.1_0: ‘If two male or female householders have set aside separate robe funds for an unrelated monk, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.37_0: ‘With these separate robe funds we’ll buy separate robes and give them to monk so-and-so;’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.38_0: If that monk approaches the kind of robe he wants without first being invited,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.39_0: ‘It would be good if you would put these separate robe funds together to buy such-and-such a robe and then give it to me,’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:1.40_0: If it has been made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.2_0: for the benefit of a monk; making a monk the object of consideration, they desire to give to him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.4_0: there are two kinds of people:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.6_0: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.8_0: any men who live at home.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.10_0: any women who live at home.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.20_0: the monk for whom the robe fund has been set aside.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.24_0: having gone to their house or having gone wherever.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.25_0: Specifies the kind of robe he wants:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.26_0: please make it long or wide or closely woven or soft.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.28_0: with that which is at their disposal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.30_0: long or wide or closely woven or soft.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.38_0: wanting something nice, wanting something expensive.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.39_0: If that lay person buys a robe that is long, wide, closely woven, or soft because of the monk’s statement, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.40_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.41_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.42_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.44_0: ‘Venerables, this robe which I received after approaching unrelated householders and specifying the kind of robe I wanted without first being invited is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.45_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.48_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.49.1_0: If the householders are unrelated and he perceives them as such, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.50_0: If the householder is unrelated, but the monk is unsure of it, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.51_0: If the householders are unrelated, but he perceives them as related, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.52_0: If the person is related, but the monk perceives them as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.53_0: If the person is related, but the monk is unsure of it, commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.54_0: If the person is related and the monk perceives them as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.55.1_0: there is no offense for him.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.60_0: if the householders wish to buy something expensive, but he gets them to buy something inexpensive;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.62_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np9:2.63_0: The ninth rule, the second training rule on what is set aside, is finished.
